overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Monitoring.

First, install @google-cloud/monitoring with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/monitoring

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/monitoringâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var monitoring = require('@google-cloud/monitoring')();

Elsewhere

var monitoring = require('@google-cloud/monitoring')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/monitoring are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: MetricServiceClient
methods.description: Manages metric descriptors, monitored resource descriptors, and time series data.

methods.name: projectPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: metricDescriptorPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified metric_descriptor resource name string.

methods.name: monitoredResourceDescriptorPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified monitored_resource_descriptor resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the projectName from a project resource.

params.name: projectName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a project resources.

methods.name: matchProjectFromMetricDescriptorName
methods.description: Parses the metricDescriptorName from a metric_descriptor resource.

params.name: metricDescriptorName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a metric_descriptor resources.

methods.name: matchMetricDescriptorFromMetricDescriptorName
methods.description: Parses the metricDescriptorName from a metric_descriptor resource.

params.name: metricDescriptorName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a metric_descriptor resources.

methods.name: matchProjectFromMonitoredResourceDescriptorName
methods.description: Parses the monitoredResourceDescriptorName from a monitored_resource_descriptor resource.

params.name: monitoredResourceDescriptorName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a monitored_resource_descriptor resources.

methods.name: matchMonitoredResourceDescriptorFromMonitoredResourceDescriptorName
methods.description: Parses the monitoredResourceDescriptorName from a monitored_resource_descriptor resource.

params.name: monitoredResourceDescriptorName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a monitored_resource_descriptor resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: listMonitoredResourceDescriptors
methods.description: Lists monitored resource descriptors that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.filter
params.description:
An optional filter describing the descriptors to be returned. The filter can reference the descriptor's type and labels. For example, the following filter returns only Google Compute Engine descriptors that have an id label:

 resource.type = starts_with("gce_") AND resource.label:id

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of google.api.MonitoredResourceDescriptor.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListMonitoredResourceDescriptorsResponse ListMonitoredResourceDescriptorsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of google.api.MonitoredResourceDescriptor.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of google.api.MonitoredResourceDescriptor in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListMonitoredResourceDescriptorsResponse ListMonitoredResourceDescriptorsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listMonitoredResourceDescriptorsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listMonitoredResourceDescriptors}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listMonitoredResourceDescriptors} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name

params.name: request.filter

methods.name: getMonitoredResourceDescriptor
methods.description: Gets a single monitored resource descriptor. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The monitored resource descriptor to get. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/monitoredResourceDescriptors/{resource_type}". The {resource_type} is a predefined type, such as cloudsql_database.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing google.api.MonitoredResourceDescriptor.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing google.api.MonitoredResourceDescriptor. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listMetricDescriptors
methods.description: Lists metric descriptors that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.filter
params.description:
If this field is empty, all custom and system-defined metric descriptors are returned. Otherwise, the filter specifies which metric descriptors are to be returned. For example, the following filter matches all custom metrics:

 metric.type = starts_with("custom.googleapis.com/")

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of google.api.MetricDescriptor.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListMetricDescriptorsResponse ListMetricDescriptorsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of google.api.MetricDescriptor.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of google.api.MetricDescriptor in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListMetricDescriptorsResponse ListMetricDescriptorsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: getMetricDescriptor
methods.description: Gets a single metric descriptor. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The metric descriptor on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/metricDescriptors/{metric_id}". An example value of {metric_id} is "compute.googleapis.com/instance/disk/read_bytes_count".

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing google.api.MetricDescriptor.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing google.api.MetricDescriptor. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: createMetricDescriptor
methods.description: Creates a new metric descriptor. User-created metric descriptors define custom metrics.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.metricDescriptor
params.description:
The new custom metric descriptor.

This object should have the same structure as google.api.MetricDescriptor

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing google.api.MetricDescriptor.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing google.api.MetricDescriptor. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: deleteMetricDescriptor
methods.description: Deletes a metric descriptor. Only user-created custom metrics can be deleted.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The metric descriptor on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/metricDescriptors/{metric_id}". An example of {metric_id} is: "custom.googleapis.com/my_test_metric".

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listTimeSeries
methods.description: Lists time series that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.filter
params.description:
A monitoring filter that specifies which time series should be returned. The filter must specify a single metric type, and can additionally specify metric labels and other information. For example:

 metric.type = "compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/usage_time" AND metric.label.instance_name = "my-instance-name"

params.name: request.interval
params.description:
The time interval for which results should be returned. Only time series that contain data points in the specified interval are included in the response.

This object should have the same structure as TimeInterval TimeInterval

params.name: request.view
params.description:
Specifies which information is returned about the time series.

The number should be among the values of TimeSeriesView TimeSeriesView

params.name: request.aggregation
params.description:
By default, the raw time series data is returned. Use this field to combine multiple time series for different views of the data.

This object should have the same structure as Aggregation Aggregation

params.name: request.orderBy
params.description: Specifies the order in which the points of the time series should be returned. By default, results are not ordered. Currently, this field must be left blank.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of TimeSeries TimeSeries.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListTimeSeriesResponse ListTimeSeriesResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of TimeSeries TimeSeries.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of TimeSeries TimeSeries in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListTimeSeriesResponse ListTimeSeriesResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listTimeSeriesStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listTimeSeries}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listTimeSeries} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.filter
params.description:
A monitoring filter that specifies which time series should be returned. The filter must specify a single metric type, and can additionally specify metric labels and other information. For example:

 metric.type = "compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/usage_time" AND metric.label.instance_name = "my-instance-name"

params.name: request.interval
params.description:
The time interval for which results should be returned. Only time series that contain data points in the specified interval are included in the response.

This object should have the same structure as TimeInterval TimeInterval

params.name: request.view
params.description:

The number should be among the values of TimeSeriesView TimeSeriesView

params.name: request.aggregation
params.description:
By default, the raw time series data is returned. Use this field to combine multiple time series for different views of the data.

This object should have the same structure as Aggregation Aggregation

params.name: request.orderBy
params.description: Specifies the order in which the points of the time series should be returned. By default, results are not ordered. Currently, this field must be left blank.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing TimeSeries TimeSeries on 'data' event.

methods.name: createTimeSeries
methods.description: Creates or adds data to one or more time series. The response is empty if all time series in the request were written. If any time series could not be written, a corresponding failure message is included in the error response.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project on which to execute the request. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.timeSeries
params.description:
The new data to be added to a list of time series. Adds at most one data point to each of several time series. The new data point must be more recent than any other point in its time series. Each TimeSeries value must fully specify a unique time series by supplying all label values for the metric and the monitored resource.

This object should have the same structure as TimeSeries TimeSeries

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: metricServiceClient
methods.description: Build a new instance of {@link MetricServiceClient}.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
